results.byline: By Jesus Jiménez and April Rubin
results.title: 4,000 Beagles Are Being Rescued From a Virginia Facility. Now They Need New Homes.
results.abstract: The authorities have about two months to find homes for the dogs, after they were found at a facility that had violated dozens of federal regulations.

media.caption: More than 100 beagles arrived in a truck from a breeding facility in Cumberland, Va., to Homeward Trails Animal Rescue.

results.title: Half of G.O.P. Voters Ready to Leave Trump Behind, Poll Finds
results.abstract: Far from consolidating his support, the former president appears weakened in his party, especially with younger and college-educated Republicans. Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida is the most popular alternative.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump at a rally in Anchorage last weekend.

results.adx_keywords: Space and Astronomy;James Webb Space Telescope
results.byline: By Dennis Overbye, Kenneth Chang and Jim Tankersley
results.title: Biden and NASA Share First Webb Space Telescope Image
results.abstract: From the White House on Monday, humanity got its first glimpse of what the observatory in space has been seeing: a cluster of early galaxies.

media.caption: The Webb telescope’s image of the galaxy cluster SMACS 0723 includes thousands of galaxies, including the faintest objects ever observed in infrared. The light from SMACS 0723 in this image is 4.6 billion years old.

results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.title: Alex Murdaugh Is Expected to Be Charged With Killing Wife and Son, Lawyer Says
results.abstract: Mr. Murdaugh, who comes from a powerful legal family in rural South Carolina, has already faced a wave of fraud and theft charges since the killings last summer.

media.caption: Alex Murdaugh, a fourth-generation lawyer, at a bond hearing last year in Varnville, S.C. He has been accused of stealing millions of dollars from clients and others.

results.title: He Fixed NASA’s Giant Space Telescope, Reluctantly
results.abstract: Gregory Robinson was enjoying another job when NASA persuaded him to take on an enormous astronomy project that was billions of dollars over budget and years behind schedule.

results.title: Susie Steiner, Author of Acclaimed British Crime Novels, Dies at 51
results.abstract: Her books found a worldwide audience, but while she wrote them she had to contend with the loss of her sight and the diagnosis of a brain tumor.

media.caption: The author Susie Steiner, whose Manon Bradshaw detective novels became popular both in England and abroad, in an undated photo.
